values.name: inline
values.prose: The float reference is the line box of the float anchor. The float containing block formatting context is the same as that of the float anchor.

values.name: column
values.prose: The float reference is the column in a multi column environment in which the float anchor is placed. If the float anchor is not inside a column, the float reference is the line box of the float anchor. The float containing block formatting context is a new block formatting context with the same dimensions and placement as the float reference.

values.name: region
values.prose: The float reference is the region in a region-chain within which the float anchor is placed. If the float anchor is not inside a region, the float reference is the line box of the float anchor. The float containing block formatting context is a new block formatting context with the same dimensions and placement as the float reference.

values.name: page
values.prose: The float reference of the float is the page within which the float anchor is placed. If the float anchor is not inside a page, the float reference is the line box of the float anchor. The float containing block formatting context is a new block formatting context with the same dimensions and placement as the float reference

properties.name: float
properties.value: block-start | block-end | inline-start | inline-end | snap-block | snap-inline | left | right | top | bottom | none

values.name: inline-start
values.prose: The element generates a box that is floated to the line-start outer edge of the float reference. Content flows on the line-end side of the box.

values.name: inline-end
values.prose: The element generates a box that is floated to the line-end outer edge of the float reference. Content flows on the line-start side of the box.

values.name: block-start
values.prose: If the float reference is a line box, block-start behaves like inline-start. If the float reference is not a line box, the element generates a box that is floated to the block-start and line-start outer edges of the float reference. The initial value of the max-width or max-height property that refers to the inline size of the float is '100%'. Content flows on the block-end side of the box.

values.name: block-end
values.prose: If the float reference is a line box, block-end behaves like inline-end. If the float reference is not a line box, the element generates a box that is floated to the block-end and line-start outer edges of the float reference. The initial value of the max-width or max-height property that refers to the inline size of the float is '100%'. Content flows on the block-start side of the box.

values.name: left
values.prose: If the float reference is a line box, behaves like inline-start or inline-end, whichever corresponds to line-left for the float reference. Otherwise, behaves like block-end, inline-start or inline-end depending on the float containing block’s direction and writing-mode.

values.name: right
values.prose: If the float reference is a line box, behaves like inline-start or inline-end, whichever corresponds to line-right for the float reference. Otherwise, behaves like block-start, inline-start or inline-end depending on the float containing block’s direction and writing-mode.

values.name: top
values.prose: Behave like block-start or inline-start depending on the float containing block’s direction and writing-mode.

values.name: bottom
values.prose: Behave like block-end or inline-end depending on the float containing block’s direction and writing-mode.

values.name: snap-block
values.prose: same as snap-block(2em, near)

values.name: snap-inline
values.prose: same as snap-inline(2em, near)

values.name: none
values.prose: The box is not floated.

properties.name: clear
properties.value: inline-start | inline-end | block-start | block-end | left | right | top | bottom | none

values.name: inline-start
values.prose: If applied to an inline float, requires that the block-start outer edge of the box comes after the block-end outer edge of any inline-start-floats with an inline-start-float-reference that resulted from elements earlier in the source document. If applied to a page float, the float reference in which the page float is placed will be seen as full when determining whether it can host subsequent page floats that float in the inline-start direction.

values.name: inline-end
values.prose: If applied to a block-level element or a float with a float-reference set to inline, requires that the block-start outer edge of the box comes after the block-end outer edge of any inline-end-floats with an inline-end-float-reference that resulted from elements earlier in the source document. If applied to a page float, the float reference in which the page float is placed will be seen as full when determining whether it can host subsequent page floats that float in the inline-end direction.

values.name: block-start
values.prose: If applied to a block-level element or a float with a float-reference set to inline, behave like inline-start. If applied to a page float, the float reference in which the page float is placed will be seen as full when determining whether it can host subsequent page floats that float in the block-start direction.

values.name: block-end
values.prose: If applied to a block-level element or a float with a float-reference set to inline, behave like inline-end. If applied to a page float, the float reference in which the page float is placed will be seen as full when determining whether it can host subsequent page floats that float in the block-end direction.

values.name: left
values.prose: Behave like block-end, inline-start or inline-end depending on the float containing block’s direction and writing-mode.

values.name: right
values.prose: Behave like block-start, inline-start or inline-end depending on the float containing block’s direction and writing-mode.

values.name: top
values.prose: Behave like block-start or inline-start depending on the float containing block’s direction and writing-mode.

values.name: bottom
values.prose: Behave like block-end or inline-end depending on the float containing block’s direction and writing-mode.
